page.title: 07The Rectory Litlington
page.content: The rectory at Litlington is an early flint house with stone facings, modernised inside but retaining some interesting features such as the stone arched doorway and a mullioned window in the north wall. There is also unusual ballustrading to the staircase called Chinese Chippendale similar to Wilmington Priory and Sackville College at East Grinstead. The house has fine cellars and an indication of an underground passage. Like many small villages, Litlington has to share a vicar with another parish,and the Old Rectory is now the home of the Bishop of Lewes together with a number of young men who are giving "a year to Christ" -working with the bishop in various ways in the local communities before following their chosen careers.
